intro: Sapium jamaicense, commonly known as Jamaican croton, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its alternate, simple leaves and distinctive yellow-orange flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. The plant's latex has been traditionally used for various medicinal purposes.
